poem:
"Of Ships and Shattered Souls"

In oceans deep, twelve wreckage relics lie.
No gulls above, only silence in reply
to tales of terror, a sunken history,
Yet, more than death, more than mystery,
A restless echo in the maritime sky.
Gibbins maps the abyss, defining why
A ship's fall is a human's try,
To conquer fate, to dare, to decry. 
Each wreck whispers of life that won't comply.
